TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
Not a question, but a notice.

1. You are editing your post. So the text editor subwindow is opened.

2. Without closing editor you like some another post (so, the focus leaves the text window and gets on the Like button).

3. You press Ctrl-Enter because there is nothing more to quote, so you have nothing to add in your post.

4. Instead of submitting your post, you get removed like on the post just liked, because the Like button is still focused.

Idk, if the Like button really needs to be focusable.

Weird thing happened today. I suddenly got IP-banned for an hour from both the forum and the wiki by CloudFlare rate limiting after having opened the past seven or so major version announcement threads looking for something in the changelogs. Is that normal?

**Edited <time datetime="2021-04-24T15:34:33Z" title="04/24/2021 03:34  PM" data-short="3 yr">April 24, 2021</time> by Fraktal**

>

> 

Is.... that... normal?     No, that's not normal!   ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")     We'll bounce this one upstairs, see what we can find out.    

Glad you're back though.

We are told the store will be offline until I Monday. We have no info on the other thing at this time.
How did you come to be moderators? I don't really want to be one, I am just wondering. Did you help in the creation of the forum or something?
Moderators are recruited from among forum members. Sometimes we invite people to apply, and other times we approach individuals we think would make good moderators.
I was asked by [@sal_vager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/16426-sal_vager/) after helping out on the IRC channel and volunteering to run a bot there as an aid to moderation.

i have been going NUTS trying to find an old thread, i swear there was this forum game that you posted multiples on, and the author (Who i think is gargamel for some reason) would give out a free copy of KSP/KSP2 to whoever posted like a digit with 6 numbers in it. i posted on it multiple times but for the life of me i cant find the thread. not in my history, not in the lounge/forum games section. not even in my chrome archive. maybe it was just a feverdream idk. Please i just need some closure on wether i can still get free stuff or not ![:cry:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/cry.png ":cry:")

I dont really expect any of you just instantly find it or tell me it was deleted but i just NEED to know what happened to it

It was a little after my acc got created, and before august 2020 i remember that

if you need more details PM me. this might not be a question related to the threads topic but hey, i didnt see any rules on what you can/cant ask ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")
What does Error code: **2F173/1** mean?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, OrdinaryKerman said:
> 
> 
> What does Error code: **2F173/1** mean?
> 

Means there has been an error.
How would you delete your account? There doesn’t seem to be an option in the account settings, would you have to request from a moderator? (Purely out of interest, not a request!).

Also, whilst searching around for the answer, I came upon the main rules and am intrigued by this one:

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> J. Roleplay, e.g. acting as a Kerbal,
> 

Has anyone ever pretended to be a Kerbal and did it cause all matter of forum unrest when they did hence the (on face value) strange rule?!

> 
> 
> 33 minutes ago, FruitGoose said:
> 
> 
> How would you delete your account? There doesn’t seem to be an option in the account settings, would you have to request from a moderator? (Purely out of interest, not a request!).
> 

If you would like to delete your account you need to fill out [the web form here](https://privacyportal-cdn.onetrust.com/dsarwebform/3efb95b4-aed7-4aa8-85d8-488eb074fa8c/696c1409-ef27-4bca-b988-79b966eaeee0.html).

>

> 
> Has anyone ever pretended to be a Kerbal and did it cause all matter of forum unrest when they did hence the (on face value) strange rule?!
